title: Elvis Presley - Snowbird revisited (2013)
description:
Title:  Snowbird Revisited  
 Label:  Gravel Road Music  
 Label Number:  GR CD 7102-2  
 Release Date:  2013  
 Recording Type:  Live Soundboard Recording  
 Location:  Las Vegas , Nevada  
 Date:  January 29 - 1971 - Dinner Show  
 Sound:  Soundboard !  
     
 Track Listing:  
01 Also Sprach Zarathustra     01:23 
02 That's All Right     01:34 
03 I Got A Woman     02:16 
04 Love Me Tender     03:17 
05 You Don't Have To Say Love Me     02:38 
06 Sweet Caroline     02:21 
07 You've Lost That Lovin' Feeling     03:01 
08 Polk Salad Annie     02:45 
09 Band Introductions     00:48 
10 Johnny B. Goode     01:43 
11 Band Introductions     01:20 
12 Something     03:22 
13 Heartbreak Hotel     01:56 
14 Blue Suede Shoes     01:14 
15 Teddy Bear     01:15 
16 Hound Dog     01:43 
17 Snowbird     03:39 
18 The Impossible Dream     03:15 
            
            
19 Snowbird (rehearsal, excerpt)     00:54 
20 Snowbird (take 1)     02:32 
21 Snowbird (take 2, 4 F.S)     02:40 
22 Snowbird (take 1 with count-in of take 2)     02:14 
23 Snowbird (take 6, vocal overdub)     02:10 
24 Telephone conversation with Elvis 
 about Las Vegas (March/April 1971)     07:13 
           
  
 Notes:  Track 22 was announced as Snowbird, undubbed master. This is wrong. Correct is that we hear on track 22 take 1 with count-in of take 2.
 Also track 21 was edited. The producer of this CD inserted the coun-in of "Where Did They Go Lord" (take 2).
 

Press info:

With great pleasure GRAVELROAD MUSIC announces the release of this excellent Show of 1971.
 Deluxe Full color Digipack with 16-page booklet includes rare photos and extensive liner notes. Also included a Special bonus gift; a reproduction of an extremely rare two sided promo card this was only available in January Ã¢â‚¬â€œ February 1971 at the International Hotel.
 The January 29, 1971 Dinner show at the International Hotel Las Vegas.

 It hardly needs introduction; the set list is a well-balanced mix with an impressive show!
 A strong mix of his hits and fills the show with his latest recordings and topping it of with par excellence covers of very popular recent top ten charts hits like Ã¢â‚¬Å“You DonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t Have To Say You Love Me, Sweet Caroline, YouÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve Lost That Loving Feeling, Polk Salad, Something, SnowbirdÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½.
Even the closing of the show had a drastic change.
 Making the performances of January /February 1971 by far the most energizing starts of a Vegas Season.

 The extraÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s are a part of the Snowbird studio session with the unreleased undubbed Master take 6 & a rare take of the vocal harmony overdub by Elvis.
 As extra bonus we included a seven-minute telephone conversation, privately taped in March/April 1971.
 Elvis talks about recording sessions and performing in Las Vegas, his scary International Hotel earthquake experience. (The California/Nevada area had a big earthquake in February 1971). 


 
Enjoy!
jeroep
